chapterTitle: Introduction to Valuation:The Time Value of Money

columns.text: In this problem, we are asked to calculate the future value of contribution to a retirement account.

**Future value** is the value that present money investment will have at a specific date in the future, given the interest rate and the number of interest periods. It can be calculated as follows:
$$\text{FV}=\text{PV}\times\left(\text{1+r}\right)^\text{t}$$
Where: 

FV = Future Value of Money (Cash Flow)\
PV = Present Value of Money (Cash Flow)\
r = Interest Rate\
t = Number of (Compounding) Periods

Let us first identify the given amounts in a problem:
||Scenario 1|Scenario 2| 
|--|--|--| 
|Present Value|$\hspace{5pt}$ $5,500|$\hspace{5pt}$ $5,500| 
|Interest Rate |$\hspace{10pt}$ 10% |$\hspace{10pt}$ 10%| 
|Number of Periods|$\hspace{12pt}$ 45 |$\hspace{12pt}$ 35| 

The number of periods in the second scenario is 45-10=35 since in the second scenario contribution to the retirement account is made 10 years less than in the first scenario.

**a) First scenario**

Let us proceed with the computation of future value for the first scenario:
$$\begin{aligned}
\text{FV} &= \text{PV}\times\text{(1+r)}^\text{t}\\[15pt]
&= 5,500 \times(1+0.10)^{45}\\[15pt]
&= \boxed{\bf\$400,897.66}
\end{aligned}$$

Assuming initial (and only) contribution to the retirement account of $5,500 and an interest rate of 10% per year, after 45 years retirement account will be worth $400,897.66.

**b) Second scenario**

Next, we need to calculate the future value for the second scenario:
$$\begin{aligned}
\text{FV} &= \text{PV}\times(1+\text{r})^\text{t}\\[15pt]
&= 5,500 \times(1+0.10)^{35}\\[15pt]
&= \boxed{\bf\$154,563.40}
\end{aligned}$$

If the initial (and only) contribution to the retirement account is made 10 years from now in the amount of $5,500 and if an interest rate is 10% per year, the retirement account will be worth $154,563.40 (45 years from now or 35 years from contribution to the account).

**To conclude, the future value in the first scenario is $400,897.66 and the future value in the second scenario is $154,563.40. This suggests that investors should choose an investment strategy from the first scenario because its future value is much higher.**
